ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 4h
I spent 4 hours/week on average.
3-10 hrs
6 hours/week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Very useful course if you are intending on pursuing a career involving research.
it was good but not geared towards specific grants which made it a bit hard
Good
This was a great course, very practical and useful. I can't think of any weakeness.
Very practical course for anyone who is planning on going into academic research. Unfortunately there were no examples of different types of NIH grants according to the new standards.
Great course, especially for those who will be submitting grants in the near future!
I feel like this class should only be taken by those who have preliminary results or who are needing to actually submit the grant.

Excellent opportunity to write an NIH-style grant and to learn about the granting process. Adrienne is flexible about letting students write different types of grants besides R01s. My only suggestion for improvement would be that there were times when it seemed a bit disorganized (wrong syllabus was posted to the website initially, people therefore weren't clear on exactly which sections of the grants were due) but when this happened Adrienne was flexible and fixed the problem.
Useful course in theory, but not immediately useful in my case, as I will not be in a position to write an R01 grant for another 8-10 years.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  She has a lot of great experience and is very organized.
Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  good. helpful with grant writing.
Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  Good

Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  The instructor was perfect on guiding us through the steps to write a grant proposal; she has a lot of experience and was really close to us all the time. I felt very much supported and I learned what I think was important.
Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  Very knowledgeable

Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  Dr. Ettinger provided excellent feedback all along the way of the course. It was an excellent idea to bring in guest lecturers to assist with different components of the grant proposal. Overall, great job.
Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  She was very helpful in directing my grant proposal.
Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  She's very competent.
Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  Very nice, very willing to help students.
Instructor: Adrienne Ettinger  The instructor did a great job with the thankless obligation of teaching a very dry, technical course.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You get out of it what you put into it, very useful if you have an idea for a project you want to implement in the future. I wouldn't take the course if you're just looking for something to fill your schedule, you need to have a specific idea of what you want out of it.
good helpful to start the grant process
Good and useful. Gave you a clear picture of how NIH funds each project.
This course is perfect for someone that wants to start writing grant proposals. I would strongly recommend it.
This class gives a good framework on how to go about writing a NIH research grant. I would recommend this course to anyone interested in going down the path of academic research.

This course provided very comprehensive instructions on the development of high-quality NIH grant proposals. I would recommend this course to any student interested in learning more about the grant writing process.
Course provides many useful skills. I have had opportunity to think more carefully about my research and I've got feedback at class.
Good opportunity to write a grant, particularly if it's one that you're actually going to submit.
Useful, but best to go in with a draft of a grant already in the works, otherwise too much work for payoff that is far removed.
